snippet: Quince, once de rigueur in America’s Colonial gardens, fell out of favor over the years. But some growers are still very attached to the fruit.
abstract: Quince, fruit tree once popular in colonial America, are still lovingly grown by some gardeners today; tips on how to tend the tree and eat the quince fruit noted.
lead_paragraph: Quince, once de rigueur in America’s Colonial gardens, fell out of favor over the years. But some growers are still very attached to the fruit.

headline.print_headline: In Praise of the Misunderstood Quince
headline.seo: In Praise of the Misunderstood Quince Tree
headline.main: In Praise of the Misunderstood Quince
